title: Atomic power and the U.S.
creator_contributor_role: United States Information Service, production company
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Nuclear energy - Economic aspects
description: Episode number 7 of Series "Atoms for Peace". This film examines the United States' nuclear energy programme for the production of electric power; five types of nuclear reactors designed by U.S. Government laboratories and American industries; nuclear plants operated and financed by private industry. Atomic fuel and technical skills developed by intensive research in the United States are available to other countries through international agreement. No other credits available.
